Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ruby A
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like its need of a facelift, but its clean and we had great service.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Christopher P
Reviews.Content: It's not the best hotel I've been to but there was nothing terrible about it. Clean, safe, easy to get to and priced right. I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: melaniegm
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Extended Stay hotels on business trips in the past and were quite satisfied. They were clean, if spartan, with a small kitchenette - our primary concern. We had reservations for a week at this facility, but when we saw the room, we bacame concerned. It looked liked the housekeekper replaced the towels but didn't clean. There were coffee grounds still in the coffee maker and a sticky drink ring on a table. We proceeded to look at three more rooms, none of which were accepible. One had a full trash can under the sink. None had a full complement of cooking or eating utensils in the kitchen. They all had stained, worn furniture and the hallways needed to be painted. We finally decided to check for bedbugs and found no mattress pads on the beds and stains on the bedspreads. At that point it didn't matter whether there were bedbugs, we were going elsewhere. The front desk clerk was very nice and understanding - the one bright spot in the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: jay j
Reviews.Content: Booked our room through Priceline on "Name your own price". Went to Indy for the weekend for our 15th anniversary. After getting the room for $30.00( $42.50 with charges ), I went and read some reviews. It was about 50/50 between good and terrible. at this point I got a little nervous as my wife is pretty particular when it comes to hotels. I can now thankfully say that all doubts were nullified!! The staff was very courteous and professional, the entire building was clean and orderly and our room was just right for 2 people. Tub was spotless, and bed was comfortable. I would book this hotel again on my own. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night. This hotel is not easy to find. It's an average facility with self contained suites and mine had a full sized refrigerator, dish washer, microwave etc. It was quiet and I felt good value for the money. It's an older place and I would rate cleanliness about 7 out of 10. The in-room wifi was not very good. One interesting thing was there was NO shampoo in the bathroom. What would that cost guys . . . maybe 15 cents? P.S. - I've learnt to carry extra when I travel. The check-in was efficient but I still probably wont return.

Reviews.Title: “Room was clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: w4559
Reviews.Content: I got this on priceline.com for $30 (with taxes and fees it was $42 total). The room was basic with a small kitchen area. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast consisted of bagels, apples and coffee. This hotel was good for a basic, no frills stay. Getting to the hotel across the Cracker Barrel parking lot was a little confusing. The location is good with easy on and off I-465.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jbea1973
Reviews.Content: Late at night when checked in ,no wake up calls, clock did'nt work. The worst was the trash and garbage piled up a foot tall behind the night stand. We would not stay for the second night. Complained and got my money back. Plus the road going back to hotel is very dark.

Reviews.Title: “5 days down 27 to go”
Reviews.Author: Superbon777
Reviews.Content: We are in the process of moving and had to find a temporary location to live since our next house wasn't ready. We looked for apartments but had to settle for an extended stay type hotel. I relocate last year to Indy and had to stay at the regular Extended Stay just a few blocks from this one. The other one was the worst place in the world to spend even one night. I figured the word Deluxe in the name of this one would make it a better place to stay. So far after five days of our 32 day stay we can hardly wait to leave. It’s in better shape than the other one down the street but not by much. Cabinet are too high for wife to reach, microwave was broke, sink faucet was broke but worked, no oven to cook in. We picked this place because we thought it was renovated but doesn't seem like it. Old out dated TVs with poor reception on an old satellite system for hotels. Every little thunderstorm caused problems for it. So far the whole time we have lived in Indy we never had a problem with our satellite reception. Furniture is old and worn which is expected a little bit. I know it’s not a five star hotel but it shouldn't be a 1 star either. We have plenty of days left to see if things can turn around. I'll post another review toward the end of our stay. Hopefully they get this pool open, the hallways are over 80 degrees in them, I need some relief.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: JMLMississippi
Reviews.Content: Loved the two-rooom suite we had at this Extended Stay. Were there for two nights, having booked on-line (and after reading the T.A. reviews!). Have found that the extended stay places are just as economical as regular motels, but love the convienence of a kitchen. Room was clean, bathroom was very clean, and bed was comfortable. Only downside were the pillows - too small and soft for our liking. There is a Cracker Barrel restaurant right in front within walking distance - another perk we like when traveling! First timers, for even short stays, have to remember the way the extended stay places work - - - it's like your own apartment. YOU have to pick up after yourself each day. YOU have to either hang up your towels to dry (or go to the desk for new ones yourself). YOU have to make your own bed. YOU have to do your own dishes (they do offer dish soap). YOU have to provide your own shampoo. The cleaning folks will only come in once a week during your stay, or more often if you pay for it. We have come to really enjoy this kind of lodging - kind of nice to sometimes leave your shoes and socks where you dropped them the day before! (Kidding!)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwilson64
Reviews.Content: our stay at the extended stay was very enjoyable. we stay at motels at least 3 times a week all year and if i had my choice i would stay there all the time. I would definitely recommend this motels to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relocating, Needed pampered”
Reviews.Author: tcaptainron60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were relocating to Indianapolis from South Carolina. We found Extended Stay Deluxe close to a job I was being transferred to. Let me tell you, after the stress of moving and not wanting to impose on family I needed pampered. Well i got it at Extended Stay Deluxe. The staff on check in. The wonderful maid that comes and takes care of me to the coffee and breakfast. I do not think I will ever leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very cean”
Reviews.Author: anrobins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after a concert because the room was well priced and the reviews seemed favorable. We weren't let down. The hotel and the room were very clean and the staff was courteous. It was late when we arrived and check-in was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Extended Stay Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: kk1425
Reviews.Content: Too many things to menton here but this hotel is smelly, dirty and broken down. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kotterklan
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellant. The room was clean. Of course there are always room for improvement, but the staff always was up for a challenge. They were on top of every problem no matter what it was. We will stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyemomkaye
Reviews.Content: The man who checked us in was fantastic and we got a great price on the room. I obviously misunderstood what I was booking and thought a one bedroom with separate living area meant there would actually be an enclosed bedroom with a door and then a separate living area. It is actually just one big living area with a small wall that separates the kitchen from the beds, but there is no real separated living area. In addtion, when I took my young children, ages five and seven down to the continental breakfast, which consisted of bagels and coffee, no juice, etc. there seemed to be a slight ant problem as ants were walking around the counter where the coffee makers were. I tried to inform someone at the front desk but could get no help. Added to this was what appeared a family of some sorts who were dragging hotel room chairs out to the parking lot where they were sitting around grilling out in the rain, which must be really good for the hotel chairs. Our room was clean and the staff that I could find was friendly, however due to the ants I was completely turned off from the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “6 months at a great extended stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenpnewman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six months, ending in May 2009. The staff was very accomodating, friendly, and courteous. No major issues, but any little one they jumped on right away. Very safe and convenient location with tons of nearby amenities. I felt very comfortable and became "right at home" there. The price was excellent, but you'll have to work that out. Best wishes in your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bztersc
Reviews.Content: We got a great room for the price. We had a king bed in a seperate room from our son who slept on the fold out couch. We only stayed one night, so not sure how it works for longer stays. Be aware that the breakfast bar only has bagels and coffee. Not necessarily a problem, just not as much as other hotels. Although for the price, it is certainly a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Extendedstay Deluxe family value”
Reviews.Author: Hollybear41
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for one night. Yummy breakfast bagels. Nice employees. We decided to stay another night as a result. Two beds, sleep sofa, kitchenette, bath, TV, nice family place. Located near restaurants, shopping, gas stations, and within 10 miles of the wonderful Children's Museum and Indy Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok - not very memorable”
Reviews.Author: cynmari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really just ok. I was not overly happy or unhappy. I probably would choose a different hotel in the area next time. I was not too happy with the arrangement of the room. It seemed a little too small. The bed was too close to the bathroom and the heater. However, it was nice to have the separate lounge chair and full kitchen. The desk had convenient outlets for a laptop and the internet is cheap ($5.00 for the entire stay). Even though it is "deluxe" it still has the standard extended stay america beds. I was a little disappointed since I find them to be a little uncomfortable and the pillows are quite flat and need to be doubled up. There were kids playing in the pool outside and they seemed to have fun so I assume that is nice too. The neighborhood has lots of restaurants to choose from and I recommend going to the art museum since it is only about 10/15 minute drive down the road! The last day I was there the toilet handle broke. I opened the tank to flush it and I noticed that the mechanism was not properly installed. It must have broken in the past and someone just "fixed" it with a little piece of string. Needless to say, it was my last day so I moved on without it bothering me too much... all in all it wasn't spectacular or anything. It wasn't bad but not exceptionally good either.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Ninee
Reviews.Content: For four days to one week this past June 2005, our group had a written contract and used eleven rooms. The meeting room that we were promised was not available when we needed it. Many of the rooms had no kitchen supplies as stated in their website. Room keycards didnt work most of the time. Rooms were missing basics such as toilet paper and linens. Refridgerators and televisions didn't work. There were no towels available for the pool. The biggest problem were the additional charges on credit cards AFTER our group left. Five people in our group were overcharged, from $53. to almost $600. The hassle to get these errors corrected was very frustrating. The person that the contract was written with was no longer at the location when our group arrived. Management was a mess. After discovering the overcharges AFTER our stay, management at the hotel never returned any phone calls. Attention was only brought to our situation after I contacted their main office in another state. I would not recommend this location to anyone. (its the one on Waldemar St). The service was not at all what their website stated, nor what was promised in our contract. Our stay was not what we expected or planned for.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of others...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 04. I was on a road trip following my alma mater for the conference tourney against Butler. Never again would I stay here. the Rooms were OKAY, nice amentities, but they were entirely too small for what they're trying to do. I'd prefer more room between the bed and the heater, so as to not be nervous throughout the night of the bed catching blaze. There are plenty of other hotels located in the same area, next time I'm follwing the team, I'm choosing one of those!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in July 2004. This is one disgusting hotel. The floor was filthy, the couch had unidentifiable stains. There were beer bottles all over the property and the staff was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: pdawg88
Reviews.Content: Desk & Management staff is lazy, went back 3 times to see if my room was clean before finally attemtping to check in after 5 p.m.. They lost track of how many guests were to check out from the night before & only had 1 of the 2 rooms I had booked. No sheets on the fold out couch, no roll aways in the hotel, desk staff making excuses, rather than trying to accomodate me. Checked out 20 minutes later and went to the drury inn a few blocks away. If you want a place that doesn't care if you stay there or not, and you want no service, you have found the right place!

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Indianapolis - Northwest - I-465
HotelInfo.Address: 9370 Waldemar Road, Indianapolis, IN 46268
